title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Remington College (Columbia, SC)
Interview Descriptions: After reviewing my resume and test scores, the Department Chairperson contacted me for a panel interview that included various questions from each panel member. I was given a tour of the campus and shortly after was made an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Remington College
Interview Descriptions: The interview included members of faculty and administration. There was a short teaching demo required followed by panel interview. The interview questions varied. The entire process lasted about an hour or so.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were varied.

title: Admissions Support Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Remington College (Lake Mary, FL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Everything was quick and easy. An email, followed by a phone interview and finally the in-person interview. If you are friendly, positive, and have basic intelligence, you’re hired. They made me a job offer not even 24 hours after I’d had the in-person interview.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to conflict with a coworker?

title: Admissions Support Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Remington College
Interview Descriptions: Processed application online quickly and received phone call within a few days after. Interviewed with two people. They took turns asking questions. I thought it was fine but have had no response to the interview. The job seems easy enough.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your workload?

title: Business Faculty Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College (Coppell, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Business department head was very professional and we had a good initial interview.  Another business faculty member joined us and this gave another good perspective of working for Remington. The department head then scheduled a teaching demonstration.  The teaching demonstration was in front of faculty and staff and included faculty outside of the business department.  This was a good opportunity to see a group that enjoy their jobs and made me want to be a part of that group.  The College is up to date with technology and one administrator joined the demonstration online.  This was an overall good experience.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience teaching in an online/blended format?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Remington College
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Met in person, reviewed resume asked some basic interview questions that were probably pulled off the internet and used to created a facade of how trivial the job is/ make it look way more important than it is....  and then took a test with basic math and reading.  Had group training after that.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: Student Finance Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Remington College in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of interviewing with the department manager and Vice President of operations. The interview was in person and it consisted of two rounds of interviews and a computer test for competency.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Remington College (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview and the director was very nice and professional. After that I did mock teaching and took a test ...it's not about pass or fail ..but if you can finish.
Interview Questions: I was asked more about my educational experience.

title: Borrower Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Remington College (Fort Worth, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process so far for me has been an interview with the Director, I have taken the second stage skills assessment after successful completion forwarded to the background check and then an offer and acceptance.
Interview Questions: What is your ability to make it on time to work?

title: Student Financial Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Remington College (Lake Mary, FL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very straightforward. The interviewer had asked me if I had previous experience with financial aid. I am a college student, so I explained that I have previously filled out a FAFSA. No technical questions, but I did have to complete a small "Wonderlic" test.- more focused on customer service and soft skills.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation that you were in that was difficult that you were able to solve?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College
Interview Descriptions: Why do you want to teach and a 15 minute teaching demonstration where you are expected to engage the students and have handouts. What is your classroom Management style? Working at the company is good if you really like teaching. Just like every other job there is politics, nepotism, and mess.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a teacher?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
This was a bit long, but worth it. 
background check/ credit check. 
[2 weeks]
Interview with program chair, if she likes you she will arrange a 2nd round interview by you presenting 15 minutes to 5- 7 other Teachers and department chairs. 
You teach a mock lessson 15 minutes.
You are asked to step outside 
[nerve wrecking part].
They take a vote as to should you come aboard [ yes or No]
Keep in mind:
During this mock lesson process we were not looking for perfect Instructors, but who would the students like AND learn from. Some people are subject matter experts, but can't relate to students. These people dont last at this school, go to UNT if you want to be disconnected but smart with a PH.D in everything, but "common sense".

This was one of the most intense memorable interviews I had. I just went in- did my mock teach & added a little comedy. I said the worst they can tell me is "NO". I already don't have the job, so what's to loose is my motto.
Interview Questions: I don't remember the questions. Although they do give you the topic (detailed) prior to the mock teach, a week in advance to create a dynamic and engaging lesson. If you are a rockstar educator- Teacher [ you will be just fine] if not get some water you are about to drown.

title: Cosmetology Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Remington College (Garland, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I've had a lengthy phone conversations. The wonderlic test, and my mock class. The hiring process is really long. I am still going thru. The one thing I was disappointed about, this will be the first hire of the directors employeement at this school. She did not know the amount of the salary for the position she is hiring for.
Interview Questions: Average questions, your teaching philosophy, team work etc... She gave typical scenerios, and I answered accordingly.

title: Medical Assistant Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Remington College
Interview Descriptions:
One on one interview and campus tour, followed by a Wonderlic test and background check are phase one of the process.

 If all of those are satisfactory, a mock teaching presentation about ten minutes long is scheduled. Several employees serve as the "class" and rate performance on a variety of skills/areas. The interviewee is not present for the feedback.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Remington College (Honolulu, HI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: My first interview was great! The Executive Assistant was very easy to talk to and made sure all of my questions were answered. There are a total of three interviews- On to the second one!
Interview Questions: "Do you think a Supervisor should be liked of feared?"

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College (Heathrow, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was your typical 1:1 with an additional group interview.
I met with my 2 potential superiors first (1:1) then once they spoke I had a secondary same day interview with my potential co-workers. Had to take a couple of tests. 1 called the Wonderlic and the other was an accountancy skills test.
Interview Questions: Accruals, other accounting related questions. Took 2 tests. One the interviewer developed. The other was the Wonderlic test.

title: Career Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Remington College (Memphis, TN) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview with director,  then skills assessment. Depending on your results you will then meet the campus president. The interview was about an hour long.  I was then scheduled to take the test the following monday. The results  are usually back with 2 ton3 hours. From then i should leanrn if i will be meeting with the campus president.
Interview Questions: What would i do if i had a student want to quit when they only have 2 montha left to graduation?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Remington College (Houston, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: application on line, first interview in a group, must take a Wonderlic test, background check and credit check before getting the 2nd interview with manager, 3rd interview campus president. And one last interview with the owner of the company
Interview Questions: How long have been an admissions representative

title: Business Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screening, meeting with hiring manager, came back for Mock testing,  which included performing a lecture on a subject in front of the hiring manager and other staff members. Took a standardized test (wonderlic) and meet with campus director before an offer was extended. There is a background and credit check that was done.
Interview Questions: Who will you keep the students engage and coming to class?

title: Allied Health Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Remington College (Dallas, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Came in and interviewed. Took about 20 minutes but it went well. Loved the staff and supervisor I spoke with. There was a test I had to take but it was pretty simple. Overall the interview went good and I felt comfortable throughout the duration of it. I asked several questions and they were answered thoroughly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. How long have I been in the field? Where do I see myself in 5 years? What type of teaching skills did I have?

title: Cosmetology Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Remington College (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 2 hours, interviewer asked me basic questions, explained what the company was looking for in a Instructor. Gave me a lesson plan for my 2nd. Interview.Also gave me a tour of the school, Interviewer was very calm, and professional.
Interview Questions: What hours did I want to work?

title: Director of Career Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Remington College (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: i initially interviewed with the president of the campus in person. he found my resume online and asked me to come in. after that i interviewed with him again and met with the director of education. then i interviewed with the regional director through video/phone interview. overall it was very simple.
Interview Questions: basic interview questions - why would you be a good fit? what are your goals?  Also took wonderlic test

title: Part Time Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College (Baton Rouge, LA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: First interview about an hour long. Set up the Wonderlich test to be taken several days later. Results back very quickly.Paperwork sent to corporate and background check and credit check done. Mock testing set up a week later.
Interview Questions: How do you get a student to do the work?

title: Allied Health Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Remington College (Memphis, TN)
Interview Descriptions: You usually are called in to interview with the supervisor that you will have, then are interviewed by Director of Education then Campus President. You must take an IQ test on the computer and pass it. Then you must complete an internal and external teaching demonstration
Interview Questions: What do you know about our company? What are some areas that you need to work on?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Remington College (Little Rock, AR)
Interview Descriptions: Total of 2 interviews. First was with Director of admissions and second was with campus president. Very general interview questions...always remain positive.
Interview Questions: How do you handle rejection?

title: Student Finance Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College
Interview Descriptions: Interview was easy. Director was really nice and made the process comfortable.
Interview Questions: Are you ready to be aggressive?

title: Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Remington College (Lafayette, LA)
Interview Descriptions: The process goes fast but you will likely go through several interviews. If you get this strange feeling that they are not a good, moral company- don't ignore it. You are getting that feeling for a reason.
Interview Questions: I can't remember specific questions as it was a while ago. I remember most questions being average. They were in a hurry to hire so it seemed pretty odd and fast.

title: Allied Health Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Remington College (Columbia, SC) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy process, extensive backgroumd check.  Must pass an intelligence test and a panel interview which includes video of Management staff from main campus.  Graded on how you dress, speak and answer questions.  A mock teaching session is required and strictly judged.  Make eye contact and enunciate as all of this is graded.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: MA Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Remington College (North Houston, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Casual, friendly, Interviewer was very nice and relaxed. I could tell he did not disclose a complete answer to my question. It went very quickly like there was an urgency to hire me. The college was on break at the time. I guess he wanted me on board before class resumed.

The overall experience was pleasant but I found unexpectedly hurried.
Interview Questions: What is my teaching style?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Remington College (Fort Worth, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: long, do a mock interview in front of corporate and if they like they'll hire, it took ten days, and they expect you to quit your present job before a two weeks notice so you leave your company with a bad name, do a presentation in front or president and corporate, turn over rate 100%, do not work here
Interview Questions:
why do you want to teach
what inspires you

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions:
This was one of the most unorganized interviewing processes I have ever been through. A receptionist contacted me to set-up the initial interview. It was to be a group interview....She thought. The receptionist was not sure and was not able to answer basic questions (the exact time of the interview, who will be the interviewer, how many people in the group, etc.) This raised red flag number one. Went to the interview the next day. The interviewer failed to introduce herself. It was not until the end of the interview that the interviewer introduced who she was (Campus President) as she forgot. Red flag number two. This was a group interview of a  few people. Questions asked were basic behavioral questions (Tell me about a time...). It lasted less than one hour. I was invited back for a one-on-one interview the following week.

The 2nd interview was awkward and a tad on the unethical side. Red flag number three was when I was asked what my spouse did for a living and how much did she make. Pretty sure these are both slightly illegal somehow, somewhere. Basic interview questions were asked and this sessions lasted around 45 minutes. 

After this second interview I did not follow-up, send a thank-you or continue on with the process. The sheer lack of professionalism, ethics, and kindness eludes this establishment. You can feel it when you walk in and it stays with you the entire time. Just not the place for me. Good luck should you decide to work there.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you over him/her?

title: Career Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I got my interview through someone that worked for the company, but it is easy to get an interview by responding to ads that are run on CareerBuilder. The first interview was with the Director of Career Services who I developed an immediate rapport with, as our career history was very similar. The interview lasted about an hour, and was mostly conversational which allowed me to say all the things I wanted her to know about me. The next step in the process was to await a call to come in for a Wonderlic Test, which I scheduled about a week after the initial interview. I was told I scored very well on the test, and was scheduled to meet with the Campus President, and the Regional Director of Career Services. They both questioned why I was interested in the position, as my work history qualified me for a stronger opportunity. My answers seemed to satisfy both of them, and I was told there would be a criminal background check, a credit check, and reference checks. About 10 or 12 days later, the Director of Career Services called to offer the job to me. I liked the people I interviewed with, but felt that I was the one leading the interview with all 3 people. Unfortunately, I later learned that the criteria to be hired, was a pleasant outgoing personality, passing the Wonderlic and all the checks into a candidate's background. This was because very few of the potential hires successfully met the criteria.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question for me was how my experience would be of value in a college career services department. It was difficult because none of the 3 interviewers explained the actual job responsibilities or defined the objectives of the job.

title: Career Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Individual interviews with the campus president and Director.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions.

title: Department Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College (Houston, TX) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had 4 interviews with 4 different people. Each person told me "we are a very ethical company. A very VERY ethical company." That is all I remember from the interviews because it struck me as odd that they all spent most of their time hammering that home. It came from a script. They are the single most unethical company I have ever worked for. What they are saying is that they need you to lie for them.
Interview Questions: "How many students have you enrolled in a program in the past? Of those students, how many stayed in the program?" I was supposed to know detailed numbers off the top of my head from a previous job. I was not allowed to guess or to look like I couldn't remember.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Remington College in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick and easy. 1st interview with DOA, 2nd with Campus president. The questions were very easy. They just wanted to fill the position as soon as possible.
Interview Questions: None, they were all pretty basic

title: Director of Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Remington College (Houston, TX) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview lasted for 1.75 hours.  Lot of questions about how to keep students in school.  There is a lot of turn over in the office from what I can tell.  Internal pressure to get funding for students no matter what it takes to get them in so they can get the money.  I would not send my dog to school here.
Interview Questions: What can you do to keep students and faculity here?
